member.name: T:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI
member.summary: Provides overall information about the game and the API itself, and provides some useful tools. More information is available in project wiki at https://github.com/ManlyMarco/KKAPI/wiki

member.name: F:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.StudioProcessName
member.summary: The studio process name for use with attributes.

member.name: F:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.GameProcessName
member.summary: The game process name for use with attributes.

member.name: F:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.VRProcessName
member.summary: The VR module process name for use with attributes.

member.name: M:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.GetCurrentGameMode
member.summary: Get current game mode.

member.name: M:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.GetGameVersion
member.summary: Get current version of the game.

member.name: M:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.IsSteamRelease
member.summary: Check if the game is the Steam release instead of the original Japanese release. It's best to not rely on this and instead make the same code work in both versions (if possible).

member.name: M:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.IsVR
member.summary: Check if this is the official VR module. Main game VR mods are ignored (returns false).

member.name: F:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.VersionConst
member.summary: Version of this assembly/plugin. WARNING: This is a const field, therefore it will be copied to your assembly! Use this field to check if the installed version of the plugin is up to date by adding this attribute to your plugin class: [BepInDependency(KoikatuAPI.GUID, KoikatuAPI.VersionConst)] THIS VALUE WILL NOT BE READ FROM THE INSTALLED VERSION, YOU WILL READ THE VALUE FROM THIS VERSION THAT YOU COMPILE YOUR PLUGIN AGAINST! More info: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/55984/what-is-the-difference-between-const-and-readonly

member.name: F:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.GUID
member.summary: GUID of this plugin, use for checking dependancies with ."/>

member.name: P:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.EnableDebugLogging
member.summary: Enables display of additional log messages when certain events are triggered within KKAPI. Useful for plugin devs to understand when controller messages are fired.

member.name: P:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.IsQuitting
member.summary: Can be used to detect if application is currently quitting.
member.value: true if application is quitting; otherwise, false.

member.name: E:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.Quitting
member.summary: Occurs when application is quitting. Plugins can use this to do things like write config files and caches, or stop outstanding coroutines to prevent shutdown delays. Note: This event might not fire if the game isn't closed cleanly (hard crashes, killed process, closing the console window, etc.).

member.name: M:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.BaseAwake
member.summary: Needs to be called at the start of Awake

member.name: M:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.CheckRequiredPlugin(BepInEx.BaseUnityPlugin,System.String,System.Version,BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel)
member.summary: Check if a plugin is loaded and has at least the minimum version. If the plugin is missing or older than minimumVersion, user is shown an error message on screen and false is returned. Warning: Run only from Start, not from constructor or Awake because some plugins might not be loaded yet!
member.param: Your plugin
Guid of the plugin your plugin is dependant on
Minimum version of the required plugin
Level of the issue - Error if plugin can't work, Warning if there might be issues, or None to not show any message.
member.returns: True if plugin exists and it's version equals or is newer than minimumVersion, otherwise false

member.name: M:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.CheckIncompatiblePlugin(BepInEx.BaseUnityPlugin,System.String,BepInEx.Logging.LogLevel)
member.summary: Check if a plugin that is not compatible with your plugin is loaded. If the plugin is loaded, user is shown a warning message on screen and true is returned. Warning: Run only from Start, not from constructor or Awake because some plugins might not be loaded yet!
member.param: Your plugin
Guid of the plugin your plugin is incompatible with
Level of the issue - Error if plugin can't work, Warning if there might be issues, or None to not show any message.
member.returns: True if plugin exists, otherwise false

member.name: M:KKAPI.KoikatuAPI.SynchronizedInvoke(System.Action)
member.summary: Invoke the Action on the main unity thread. Use to synchronize your threads.

member.name: T:KKAPI.Chara.CharacterApi
member.summary: Provides an easy way to add custom logic to all characters in the game and in studio. It takes care of all the error-prone plumbing and lets you easily save and load data to the character cards.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharacterApi.RegisterExtraBehaviour``1(System.String)
member.summary: Register new functionality that will be automatically added to all characters (where applicable). Offers easy API for saving and loading extended data, and for running logic to apply it to the characters. All necessary hooking and event subscribing is done for you. All you have to do is create a type that inherits from CharaExtraBehaviour (don't make instances, the API will make them for you).
member.typeparam: Type with your custom logic to add to a character
member.param: Extended data ID used by this behaviour. Set to null if not used. Needed to copy the data in some situations.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharacterApi.RegisterExtraBehaviour``1(System.String,System.Int32)

member.typeparam: Type with your custom logic to add to a character
member.param: Extended data ID used by this behaviour. Set to null if not used. Needed to copy the data in some situations.

member.summary: Gets full path to the file where this ChaFile was loaded from. Usually this means the character card, but can also point to a studio scene or a game save file if the character was contained inside them. If the ChaFile was loaded from memory or copied, this will most likely return null. Might not work in maker in some games (todo).

member.name: T:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController
member.summary:
Base type for custom character extensions. It provides many useful methods that abstract away the nasty hooks needed to figure out when a character is changed or how to save and load your custom data to the character card.
This controller is a MonoBehaviour that is added to root gameObjects of ALL characters spawned into the game. It's recommended to not use constructors, Awake or Start in controllers. Use instead.

member.summary: ChaControl of the character this controller is attached to. It's on the same gameObject as this controller.

member.summary: ChaFile of the character this controller is attached to.

member.summary: ID used for extended data by this controller. It's set when registering the controller with

member.summary: Definition of this kind of function controllers.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController.GetExtendedData
member.summary: Get extended data based on supplied ExtendedDataId. When in chara maker loads data from character that's being loaded. This should be used inside the event. Consider using one of the other "Get___ExtData" and "Set___ExtData" methods instead since they are more reliable and handle copying and transferring outfits and they conform to built in maker load toggles.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController.GetExtendedData(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get extended data of the current character by using the ID you specified when registering this controller. This should be used inside the event. Consider using one of the other "Get___ExtData" and "Set___ExtData" methods instead since they are more reliable and handle copying and transferring outfits and they conform to built in maker load toggles.
member.param: If true, when in chara maker load data from character that's being loaded. When outside maker or false, always grab current character's data.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController.SetExtendedData(ExtensibleSaveFormat.PluginData)
member.summary: Save your custom data to the character card under the ID you specified when registering this controller. This should be used inside the event. Consider using one of the other "Get___ExtData" and "Set___ExtData" methods instead since they are more reliable and handle copying and transferring outfits and they conform to built in maker load toggles.
member.param: Your custom data to be written to the character card. Can be null to remove the data.

member.summary: Get extended data of the specified coordinate by using the ID you specified when registering this controller. This should be used inside the event. Consider using one of the other "Get___ExtData" and "Set___ExtData" methods instead since they are more reliable and handle copying and transferring outfits and they conform to built in maker load toggles.
member.param: Coordinate you want to get the data from

Consider using one of the other "Get___ExtData" and "Set___ExtData" methods instead since they are more reliable and handle copying and transferring outfits and they conform to built in maker load toggles.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController.OnCardBeingSaved(KKAPI.GameMode)
member.summary: Fired when the character information is being saved. It handles all types of saving (to character card, to a scene etc.) Write any of your extended data in this method by using . Avoid reusing old PluginData since we might no longer be pointed to the same character.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController.OnReload(KKAPI.GameMode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: OnReload is fired whenever the character's state needs to be updated. This might be beacuse the character was just loaded into the game, was replaced with a different character, etc. Use this method instead of Awake and Start. It will always get called before other methods, but after the character is in a usable state. WARNING: Make sure to completely reset your state in this method! Assume that all of your variables are no longer valid!
member.param: Game mode we are currently in
If true, the current state should be preserved. Do not load new extended data, instead reuse what you currently have or do nothing.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController.OnReload(KKAPI.GameMode)
member.summary: OnReload is fired whenever the character's state needs to be updated. This might be beacuse the character was just loaded into the game, was replaced with a different character, etc. Use this method instead of Awake and Start. It will always get called before other methods, but after the character is in a usable state. WARNING: Make sure to completely reset your state in this method! Assume that all of your variables are no longer valid! WARNING: Will not get fired if disabled in , use overloads with maintainState parameter in that case.
member.param: Game mode we are currently in

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController.OnCoordinateBeingSaved(AIChara.ChaFileCoordinate)

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController.OnCoordinateBeingLoaded(AIChara.ChaFileCoordinate,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fired just after loading a coordinate card into the current coordinate slot. Use to get save data of the loaded coordinate.
member.param: Coordinate being currently loaded.
If true, the current state should be preserved. Do not load new extended data, instead reuse what you currently have or do nothing.

member.summary: Fired just after loading a coordinate card into the current coordinate slot. Use to get save data of the loaded coordinate. Will not get fired if disabled in , use overloads with maintainState parameter in that case.
member.param: Coordinate being currently loaded.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Chara.CharaCustomFunctionController.GetClothesExtData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get extended data for specific clothes. Do not store this data because it might change without notice, for example when clothing is copied. Always call Get at the point where you need the data, not earlier. If you change any of the data, remember to call the corresponding Set method or the change might not be saved. This data is saved alongside game data, which means it is automatically copied and moved as necessary. If no extended data of this plugin was set yet, this method will return null. In maker, you can update controls that use this data in the event.
member.param: The coordinate number to open extened data for if the game supports multiple coords (0-indexed). -1 will use the current coordinate.

This data is saved alongside game data, which means it is automatically copied and moved as necessary. If no extended data of this plugin was set yet, this method will return null. In maker, you can update controls that use this data in the event.
member.param: The accessory part number to open extened data for (0-indexed).
The coordinate number to open extened data for if the game supports multiple coords (0-indexed). -1 will use the current coordinate.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.GetMakerSex
member.summary: 0 is male, 1 is female

member.name: M:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.GetMakerBase
member.summary: Returns current maker logic instance. Same as

member.name: M:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.GetCharacterControl
member.summary: Get the ChaControl of the character serving as a preview in character maker. Outside of character maker and early on in maker load process this returns null.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.RegisterCustomSubCategories
member.summary: This event is fired every time the character maker is being loaded, near the very beginning. This is the only chance to add custom sub categories. Custom controls can be added now on later in . Warning: All custom subcategories and custom controls are cleared on maker exit and need to be re-added on next maker start. It's recommended to completely clear your GUI state in in preparation for loading into maker again.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.MakerStartedLoading
member.summary: Early in the process of maker loading. Most game components are initialized and had their Start methods ran. Warning: Some components and objects might not be loaded or initialized yet, especially if they are mods. Warning: All custom subcategories and custom controls are cleared on maker exit and need to be re-added on next maker start.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.MakerBaseLoaded
member.summary: Maker is fully loaded. Use to load mods that rely on something that is loaded late, else use MakerStartedLoading. This is the last chance to add custom controls! Warning: All custom subcategories and custom controls are cleared on maker exit and need to be re-added on next maker start.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.MakerFinishedLoading
member.summary: Maker is fully loaded and the user has control. Warning: Avoid loading mods or doing anything heavy in this event.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.MakerExiting
member.summary: Fired after the user exits the maker. Use this to clean up any references and resources. You want to return to the state you were in before maker was loaded.

member.name: P:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.CharaListIsLoading
member.summary: Use to avoid unnecessary processing cards when they are loaded to the character list. For example, don't load extended data for these characters since it's never used.

member.name: P:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.LastLoadedChaFile
member.summary: ChaFile of the character currently opened in maker. Do not use to save extended data, or it will be lost when saving the card. Use ChaFile from ExtendedSave.CardBeingSaved event to save extended data instead.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.ChaFileLoaded
member.summary:
Fired when the current ChaFile in maker is being changed by loading other cards or coordinates. This event is only fired when inside the character maker.
You might need to wait for the next frame with before handling this.

member.name: E:KKAPI.Maker.MakerAPI.ReloadCustomInterface
member.summary: Fired after character or coordinate is loaded in maker, after all controllers had their events fired. This event is only fired when inside the character maker. Use this to update values of custom controls. EventArgs can be either or depending on why the reload happened.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.TimelineCompatibility.Play
member.summary: Play/Pause timeline playback (toggles between the two).

Adds an interpolableModel with a dynamic parameter to the available interpolables list. This interpolable can then be instantiated by the user by adding a keyframe. The dynamic parameter means that every time user creates this interpolable, you can provide a different parameter - this allows having multiple instances of this interpolable for a single studio object. The instances are differentiated by the parameter, which must be unique and have a unique hash code (if the parameters have identical hashes they are treated as the same thing). Examples where this is useful: editing individual character bone positions/scales, changing color of individual accessories. If you want to make a global interpolable you can use AddInterpolableModelStatic instead. Try to keep the callbacks as light and self-contained as possible since they can be called on every frame during playback or UI usage (except the xml callbacks). If you need to find some object to later use in the callbacks, consider using it as the parameter (that way it will only be computed once and you can use it later for free, just make sure the parameter is always the same since if you have different parameters will create separate instances).
member.remarks:
Use cases:
To make a global interpolable (affects overall studio state) set to false and don't provide unique parameters (or any parameters at all).
To make a single interpolable per studio object (e.g. changing a character's hair color) set to true and don't provide unique parameters (or any parameters at all).
To make multiple interpolables per studio object (e.g. changing color of different clothing items) set to true and provide unique parameters that represent the exact thing that is being changed. How this works: When user adds a new interpolable then
Execution order:
InterpolableModel is created and added
is called when any studio object is selected (null if nothing is selected)
When user adds a new keyframe for this interpolable, is called to determine if it can be created.
and are called in that order. The new interpolable's hash is computed based on and the returned parameter.
and are called after creating the interpolable and every time the user does something that should update the UI.
If playing, and are called in that order. called before each of them to determine if the callbacks should be ran. Put logic that affects the studio object here (e.g. changing bone position).
When saving the studio scene or just the timeline data, and are called as necessary.
member.typeparam: The type of the value.
The type of the parameter.
member.param: Display name of the owner of this interpolable. It's used both in the UI and for serialization. Must not change between game restarts.
ID of this interpolable used for serialization. Must be unique and not change between game restarts.
Display name shown in the available interpolable list. It's also used for names of the created interpolable instances if is not provided.
Func that should return true if this interpolable can be used on the given studio object. This is called before all other callbacks and before the interpolable is actually created. oci is OCIChar
Get the current value of this interpolable. If loading timeline data, is used instead. ((Transform)parameter).localPosition
Deserialize a value of this interpolable from XML. It's optional as long as you use a common simple value type like or that has a deserializer available. node.ReadVector3("value")
Serialize a value of this interpolable to XML. It's optional as long as you use a common simple value type like or that has a serializer available. writer.WriteValue("value", (Vector3)obj)

Get object/data to apply changes to. The main use of parameters is when you can have multiple instances of this interpolable on a single studio object - you can then use parameters to differentiate individual parts, e.g. bones. For example you can use the transform that this interporable will affect (set its position etc.) as a parameter - that way you can have separate interpolables for different transforms of the same studio object. This parameter will be passed to other callbacks, and it will be serialized and deserialized when saving/loading timeline data (serializing it is optional but without serializing the parameter you will lose it after scene reload). If you are using parameters, make sure to implement as well - it's used to give different names to interpolables based on the parameter (e.g. transform name). Note: Everything related to parameters is optional and can be skipped if you don't need multiple instances of the interpolable on a single studio object. Parameters should be hashable (hash should be stable during the game session). ((OCIChar)oci).GetChaControl().transform.Find("someBone")
Deserialize a parameter previosuly saved with . return oci.guideObject.transformTarget.transform.Find(node.Attributes["parameter"].Value));

Serialize the parameter to store it inside timeline data. It will be later deserialized with . For example if you use a for your parameter, you can write its path or name if its unique, and then search for it when deserializing. writer.WriteAttributeString("parameter", ((Transform)parameter).name);
Check if the parameter and data are valid and can be interpolated. If false is returned, and are not called (everything else is unaffected).
If true, assign this interpolable to a specific studio object. If false, the interpolable is global and most callbacks will be given null as the argument.
Get a name for a newly created interpolable instance. Use to differentiate different instances of the same interpolable. If null, is used.
Check if this interpolable instance should apper in the list given the current state. This is called on every list refresh after the interpolable is created.

member.summary: Adds an interpolableModel to the available interpolables list. This interpolable can then be instantiated by the user by adding a keyframe. User can create a single instance of this interpolable for each studio object (or single instance globally if is false). If you want to have multiple instances of this interpolable for a single studio object use AddInterpolableModelDynamic instead. Try to keep the callbacks as light and self-contained as possible since they can be called on every frame during playback or UI usage (except the xml callbacks).
member.param: Optional parameter for this interpolable. Mostly useful for global interpolables where required objects might be expensive to get.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.TimelineCompatibility.RefreshInterpolablesList
member.summary: Refreshes the list of displayed interpolables. This function is quite heavy as it must go through each InterpolableModel and check if it's compatible with the current target. It is called automatically by Timeline when selecting another Workspace object or GuideObject. This triggers visibility checks of all interpolables and can be used to force update all instances of your interpolables if something important changes and Timeline doesn't notice it.

member.name: T:KKAPI.Utilities.ConfigurationManagerAttributes
member.summary:
Class that specifies how a setting should be displayed inside the ConfigurationManager settings window.
Usage: You can use this copy of the class instead of including it in your own plugin. Make a new instance, assign any fields that you want to override, and pass it as a tag for your setting.
If a field is null (default), it will be ignored and won't change how the setting is displayed. If a field is non-null (you assigned a value to it), it will override default behavior.
member.remarks: You can read more and see examples in the readme at https://github.com/BepInEx/BepInEx.ConfigurationManager You can optionally remove fields that you won't use from this class, it's the same as leaving them null.

member.name: T:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils
member.summary: Utility methods for working with coroutines.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.AppendCo(System.Collections.IEnumerator,System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls the appendCoroutine after baseCoroutine finishes

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.AppendCo(System.Collections.IEnumerator,UnityEngine.YieldInstruction)
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls the yieldInstruction after baseCoroutine finishes. Useless on its own, append further coroutines to run after this.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.AppendCo(System.Collections.IEnumerator,System.Action[])
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls each of the actions in order after base coroutine finishes. One action is called per frame. First action is called right after the coroutine finishes.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.CreateCoroutine(System.Action[])
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls each of the action delegates on consecutive frames. One action is called per frame. First action is called right away. There is no frame skip after the last action.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.CreateCoroutine(UnityEngine.YieldInstruction,System.Action[])
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls each of the action delegates on consecutive frames. One action is called per frame. First action is called right after the yieldInstruction. There is no frame skip after the last action.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.ComposeCoroutine(System.Collections.IEnumerator[])
member.summary: Create a coroutine that calls each of the supplied coroutines in order.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.AttachToYield(System.Collections.IEnumerator,System.Action)
member.summary: Create a coroutine that is the same as the supplied coroutine, except every time it yields the onYieldAction is invoked. (i.e. onYieldAction is invoked after every yield return in the original coroutine) If the coroutine returns another coroutine, the action is not called for yields performed by the returned coroutine, only the topmost one. Use FlattenCo if that's an issue.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.FlattenCo(System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: Flatten the coroutine to yield all values directly. Any coroutines yield returned by this coroutine will have their values directly returned by this new coroutine (this is recursive). For example if another coroutine is yielded by this coroutine, the yielded coroutine will not be returned and instead the values that it yields will be returned. If a yielded coroutine yields yet another coroutine, that second coroutine's values will be returned directly from the flattened coroutine.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.StripYields(System.Collections.IEnumerator,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remove yields from the coroutine, making its code run immediately.
member.param: Coroutine to strip
Should only yield return null be stripped? If false, all yields are stripped

Should the coroutine be flattened before stripping it? If this is false then yields from coroutines returned by this coroutine will not be stripped. If this and onlyStripNulls are both false, coroutines returned by this coroutine will not be executed.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.RunImmediately(System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: Fully executes the coroutine synchronously (immediately run all of its code till completion).

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.PreventFromCrashing(System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: Prevent a coroutine from getting stopped by exceptions. Exceptions are caught and logged. Code after the exception is thrown doesn't run up until the next yield. The coroutine continues after the yield then.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.GetMoveNext(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Find the compiler-generated MoveNext method that contains the Coroutine/UniTask code. It can be used to apply transpliers to Coroutines and UniTasks. Note: When writing transpliers for coroutines you might want to turn off the "Decompiler\Decompile enumerators" setting in DnSpy so that you can see the real code. UniTasks are considered "async/await" so you need to turn off the "Decompile async methods" setting instead.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.PatchMoveNext(HarmonyLib.Harmony,System.Reflection.MethodBase,HarmonyLib.HarmonyMethod,HarmonyLib.HarmonyMethod,HarmonyLib.HarmonyMethod,HarmonyLib.HarmonyMethod,HarmonyLib.HarmonyMethod)
member.summary: Used to patch coroutines/IEnumerator methods and async UniTask methods. This will method automatically find the compiler-generated MoveNext method that contains the coroutine code and apply patches on that. The method you patch must return an IEnumerator or an UniTask. Warning: Postfix patches will not work as expected, they might be fired after every iteration. Prefix is practically the same as prefixing the entry method. It's best to only use transpliers with this method. Note: When writing transpliers you might want to turn off the "Decompiler\Decompile enumerators/async" settings in DnSpy so that you can see the real code.

member.name: F:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.WaitForEndOfFrame
member.summary: Cached WaitForEndOfFrame. Use instead of creating a new instance every time to reduce garbage production.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.CoroutineUtils.StopCoOnQuit(System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: Create a coroutine that is the same as the supplied coroutine, but will stop early if is true. If the coroutine returns another coroutine, the check only runs on the topmost one. Use if that's an issue.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Utilities.ResourceUtils.GetEmbeddedResource(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Get a file set as "Embedded Resource" from the assembly that is calling this code, or optionally from a specified assembly. The filename is matched to the end of the resource path, no need to give the full path. If 0 or more than 1 resources match the provided filename, an exception is thrown. For example if you have a file "ProjectRoot\Resources\icon.png" set as "Embedded Resource", you can use this to load it by doing GetEmbeddedResource("icon.png"), assuming that no other embedded files have the same name.
member.exception: Thrown if none or more than one resources were found matching the given resourceFileName

member.summary: Show windows file open dialog. Blocks the thread until user closes the dialog. Returns list of selected files, or null if user cancelled the action.
member.param: A string to be placed in the title bar of the dialog box. If this member is NULL, the system uses the default title (that is, Save As or Open)
The initial directory. The algorithm for selecting the initial directory varies on different platforms.
A list of filter pairs separated by |. First item is the display name, while the second is the actual filter (e.g. *.txt) Example: "Log files (.log)|*.log|All files|*.*"
The default extension. This extension is appended to the file name if the user fails to type an extension.
A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box. When the dialog box returns, it sets these flags to indicate the user's input. This member can be a combination of the CommomDialgueFlags.
Hwnd pointer of the owner window. IntPtr.Zero to use default parent
Filename that is initially entered in the filename box.

member.summary: Show windows file open dialog. Doesn't pause the game.
member.param: Action that gets called with results of user's selection. Returns list of selected files, or null if user cancelled the action. WARNING: This runs on another thread! Game will crash if you attempt to access unity methods. You can use KoikatuAPI.SynchronizedInvoke to go back to the main thread.
A string to be placed in the title bar of the dialog box. If this member is NULL, the system uses the default title (that is, Save As or Open)

The default extension. This extension is appended to the file name if the user fails to type an extension.
A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box. When the dialog box returns, it sets these flags to indicate the user's input. This member can be a combination of the CommomDialgueFlags.

member.name: T:KKAPI.Studio.SaveLoad.SceneCustomFunctionController
member.summary:
Base type for custom scene/studio extensions. It provides many useful methods that abstract away the nasty hooks needed to figure out when a scene is loaded or imported, or how to save and load your custom data to the scene file.
This controller is a MonoBehaviour that is created upon registration in . The controller is created only once. If it's created too late it might miss some scene load events. It's recommended to register controllers in your Start method.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Studio.SaveLoad.SceneCustomFunctionController.OnSceneLoad(KKAPI.Studio.SaveLoad.SceneOperationKind,KKAPI.Utilities.ReadOnlyDictionary{System.Int32,Studio.ObjectCtrlInfo})

member.param: Operation that caused this event

A dictionary of items loaded by this operation and their original IDs. The IDs are identical to the IDs at the time of saving the scene, even during import. Warning: The IDs here might not be the same as IDs of the objects in the scene! To get current scene ID of the object call

member.name: T:KKAPI.Studio.SaveLoad.StudioSaveLoadApi
member.summary: Provides API for loading and saving scenes, as well as a convenient way for registering custom studio functions.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Studio.SaveLoad.StudioSaveLoadApi.RegisterExtraBehaviour``1(System.String)
member.summary: Register new functionality that will be added to studio. Offers easy API for saving and loading extended data. All necessary hooking and event subscribing is done for you. Importing scenes is also handled for you. All you have to do is create a type that inherits from > (don't make instances, the API will make them for you). Warning: The custom controller is immediately created when it's registered, but its OnSceneLoad method is not called until a scene actually loads. This might mean that if the registration happens too late you will potentially miss some load events.
member.typeparam: Type with your custom logic to add to a character
member.param: Extended data ID used by this behaviour. Set to null if not used.

member.name: M:KKAPI.Studio.UI.CustomToolbarButtons.AddLeftToolbarToggle(UnityEngine.Texture2D,System.Boolean,System.Action{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Add a toggle button to the top of the left studio toolbar. Clicking on the button will toggle it between being on and off.
member.param: A 32x32 icon used for the button. You can find a template here https://github.com/IllusionMods/IllusionModdingAPI/blob/master/doc/studio%20icon%20template.png For best performance and smallest size save your thumbnail as 8bit grayscale png (or indexed if you need colors) with no alpha channel.
Initial state of the toggle.
Action fired each time user clicks on the toggle button. The value is true if the toggle is enabled by the click, false if disabled.

members.member:

///

member.name: T:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage
member.summary: A class for storing textures that should be saved and loaded from extended data's (e.g. to character cards and scenes). Duplicate textures are automatically handled so that only one copy of the texture is held in memory and saved.

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.#ctor(UnityEngine.TextureFormat)
member.summary: Create a new TextureStorage.
member.param: Format of the loaded textures. It doesn't affect data saved to extended data.

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.PurgeUnused(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Remove unused textures based on a list of used IDs. Textures with IDs not in the list will be removed.
member.param: A list of IDs to be kept if they exist

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.GetAllTextureIDs
member.summary: Get IDs of all textures stored in this object.

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.Clear(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clear the texture list and optionally destroy all textures.

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.Load(ExtensibleSaveFormat.PluginData)
member.summary: Load textures from extended data that were stored with .

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.Save(ExtensibleSaveFormat.PluginData)
member.summary: Save textures stored in this object to extended data. Can be loaded later with .

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.StoreTexture(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Store a texture and get an ID representing it. The ID can be used to get the texture with . If you try to store a texture that was already stored before, the ID of the previous texture is returned so there are no multiple identical textures stored.
member.param: Raw PNG data of the texture. If you reuse a texture make sure you always use the same PNG data or deduplicating won't work.

member.name: M:KoiSkinOverlayX.TextureStorage.GetSharedTexture(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a texture based on texture ID. The same texture is returned every time, so it shouldn't be destroyed.
member.param: ID of the texture you want to get. You get the ID when using .
